exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Plot Dose–Response with TD and ED Highlighted

Source: R/plot_td_ed.R
plot_td_ed.Rd
plot_td_ed(
  e0 = 4.5,
  emax = 1.55,
  ed50 = 10,
  delta = 1,
  prop = 0.9,
  max_dose = 160 + 160/2,
  sd_uncertainty = 5,
  seed = 123,
  transform = TRUE,
  show_rect = TRUE,
  x_breaks = NULL
)

Arguments

e0

Numeric. Placebo effect.

emax

Numeric. Maximum effect over placebo.

ed50

Numeric. Dose producing 50

deltaNumeric. Target effect over placebo (used to compute TD).

propNumeric. Proportion of maximum effect for ED (e.g. 0.9 for 90max_doseNumeric. Maximum dose to consider.sd_uncertaintyNumeric. Standard deviation for uncertainty simulation.seedInteger. Random seed.transformLogical. If TRUE, response is normalized to 0–100show_rectLogical. Whether to show TD/ED range rectangles.A ggplot object.This function visualizes a normalized dose–response curve using an Emax model. It highlights the Target Dose (TD) and Effective Dose (ED) regions, optionally with uncertainty.plot_td_ed() plot_td_ed(delta = 1.5, sd_uncertainty = 3) plot_td_ed(max_dose = 300, prop = 0.75) plot_td_ed(transform = FALSE, sd_uncertainty = 2) plot_td_ed(show_rect = FALSE)
